name: Northchess
description:
Northchess is a full-stack chess variants application created in collaboration with fellow students as the final project of the Northcoders bootcamp.
The app is written using the multi-platform Flutter framework built on the Dart programming language.
We used WebSockets to facilitate real-time relaying of information between clients via the server, allowing multiple games to be played simultaneously.
The technologies used and app itself were quite different from the React CRUD applications the bootcamp focussed on, presenting an interesting challenge.

name: NC-News
description:
NC-News is a full-stack CRUD application combining the two projects ending the backend and frontend phases of the Northcoders bootcamp.
The backend uses an express server accessing a postgres database to serve REST API endpoints. Supertest in conjunction with husky pre-commit hooks were used in development to ensure things were working as intended.
 The frontend features a React single-page application which makes use of these endpoints to present a mock of an interactive news article website.
